om t nserc ocom SubjectNWP System Notice Clay Basin Shutin Testing Post Date January Category CRITICAL NOTES Subcategory MISCELLANEOUS Subject Clay Basin Shutin Testing Notice Text All Shippers Letter Date Hrs Notice to Northwest Pipeline Shippers Questar Pipeline posted the following notice on January regarding Clay Basin capacity holders Notice identifier NOTICE TO CLAY BASIN CAPACITY HOLDERS As previously reported in October Questar Pipeline Company is planning to perform inventory verification and deliverability tests at its Clay Basin storage facility beginning April These tests will involve a day shutin of Clay Basin for reservoir gas inventory verification followed immediately by a day field deliverability test In an effort to allow our shippers time to minimize the impact of the testing as much as possible we are providing the following information on the planned testing During the day shut in from April through April Clay Basin customers will not be able to utilize their storage service Beginning at am on April an Operational Flow Order will be issued to facilitate the deliverability flow test During the day flow test period all FSS capacity holders will be required to take a prorata share of their withdrawal capacity based on their contracted percentage of Clay Basins total working gas storage capacity No injections will be allowed during the flow test The planned deliverability test will be conducted as follows During each test day all storage customers will be required to make a withdrawal and corresponding transportation nomination The volume of the required withdrawal nomination will be calculated as follows April allocation Customers Contracted Percentage of Working Capacity x MDth D Daily flow requirement April allocation Customers Contracted Percentage of Working Capacity x MDth D Daily flow requirement Example A storage customer holds annual FSS storage capacity of Dth Its minimum nomination would be calculated as follows April Flow Requirement Dth Dth x Dth D Dth April Flow Requirement Dth Dth x Dth D Dth Important Note The flow rates and daily flow requirements above are based on the minimum flow rates necessary to conduct the deliverability test Depending on conditions in the basin at the time of the test customers may be required to increase their withdrawal rates by up to FSS capacity holders will be required to have adequate inventory in Clay Basin and transportation capacity to facilitate the flow test If it is necessary to cancel the deliverability test due to conditions beyond Questars reasonable ability to prevent or control Questar will notify customers of cancellation as soon as possible Questar will work with storage customers to facilitate transportation of their gas supply and to mitigate the impact as much as possible during the testing period Please do not hesitate to contact your Questar marketing or customer service representative with any questions regarding the upcoming tests Northwest Pipeline will assist its shippers in meeting the flow requirements for the deliverability tests scheduled on April and Northwest will notify customers as more information becomes available Please contact your Marketing Services Representative for assistance MDRrm
